intro: Antheliacanthus, commonly known as the "devil's needle," is a rare and unusual plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, spire-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are often hidden among the foliage. The plant is native to arid regions of North America and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it an interesting subject for botanical study. Due to its rarity, Antheliacanthus is considered endangered and is protected in many areas.
